author: mirichmo
body:
Before submitting this issue, please first:
- [ ] Search the existing issues.
- [ ] Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- [ ] Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- [ ] If it is a bug, fill out this form:
## Steps to reproduce

Get-LocalUser
## Expected behavior

Get-LocalUser displays a list of users of the system
## Actual behavior

Cmdlet fails
## Environment data

In Windows, the cmdlets depend on the Security Accounts Manager API. Alternate techniques will be required to port the cmdlets to *nix.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: @KrisBash @joeyaiello I can port the code to be built out of PowerShell repo, but I do not know what the planned story is for Linux.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is in Windows now. There is no planned support for Linux currently, and failing gracefully is covered under #1122.

title: Microsoft.PowerShell.LocalAccounts Support is Missing
